definition: to stay level (of exchange rate, market share etc)/fair/unbiased
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: At the cost balance point on the institutional margin, the allocation of power achieves Pareto Optimality.
sentences.chinese: 在制度邊際成本持平處權力的配置達到帕累托最優。

sentences.english: A fine stick of gradual decrease in cross-section is supported by a fulcrum and keeps its balance in the horizontal direction.
sentences.chinese: 截面漸減細棒由一支點支撐，在水平方向上保持平衡。

sentences.english: I glimpsed the dancer balancing herself on the ambulance by become.
sentences.chinese: 我掽巧瞥見舞蹈者在捄護車上使自己保持平衡。

sentences.english: I use a quick mental checklist each day to help me stay balanced.
sentences.chinese: 我每天使用一種迅速腦力備忘錄幫助我保持平衡。

sentences.english: Full adjustable push rods under forks ensure stability of forks.
sentences.chinese: 推杆可調，使貨叉保持平衡。

sentences.english: Unique Korg feature lets you tune down to 5 semitones flat.
sentences.chinese: Korg的獨特功能可讓您調整到5個半音持平。

sentences.english: Mark churned wildly through the muck trying to keep up.
sentences.chinese: 馬克在污泥中拚命搖晃着努力保持平衡。

sentences.english: It helps them to measure the profitability of products, establish break-even points and so on.
sentences.chinese: 還幫助他們估量產品的盈利能力，定出持平點等等。

sentences.english: Prices are the same as, or lower than, loose pills, and treatment is easier to finance.
sentences.chinese: 價格與散裝藥丸持平或者略低，治療費用較易承受。

sentences.english: The boy keeps the seesaw in balance.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩兒讓蹺蹺板保持平衡。

sentences.english: The red-black tree is always balanced.
sentences.chinese: 紅黑樹可以始終保持平衡。

sentences.english: Despite having had two children, her stomach is washboard flat.
sentences.chinese: 儘管有過兩個孩子，她的肚子是搓板持平。

sentences.english: He did not know how much of the pressure was because of her need for balance.
sentences.chinese: 他不知道她使這麼大勁有多少原因是爲了保持平衡。

sentences.english: Step 1 - For balance , hold a basketball or volleyball at chest level.
sentences.chinese: 爲了保持平衡，在胸部抱一個籃球或排球。

sentences.english: Therefore, even if the glass is full, the weight of the plate is balanced.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，即使杯子中盛滿酒，盤子仍然可以保持平衡。

sentences.english: High techs are mixed and Intel is unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 高科技類股漲跌互見，英特爾股價持平。

definition: the corresponding time period (in a different year etc)/concurrent/synchronous
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
degree of reduction (in prices, numbers etc)/decline/drop
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
